abstract: The officer in Brooklyn is accused of federal civil rights violations that stem from a confrontation outside a bar, in which the officer is said to have used pepper spray against patrons.
snippet: The officer in Brooklyn is accused of federal civil rights violations that stem from a confrontation outside a bar, in which the officer is said to have used pepper spray against patrons.
lead_paragraph: 7:23 p.m. | Updated It was the Fourth of July weekend in 2008 at the Living Room Lounge in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn, when a uniformed New York police officer issued a threat: No one, he said, "messes with my cousin's place."

headline.main: Officer Faces Charges He Abused His Authority
